intro: Trichodesma stenosepalum, commonly known as the narrow-sepal trichodesma, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many plants with nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and trifoliate leaves, typical of the genus Trichodesma. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along coastal areas. Due to its adaptability, it is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects in degraded landscapes.
